Package game

Interface GameInterface

public interface GameInterface
Game class which manages the state of the elements that make up the game.
Author:
Eduardo Correia, Alberto Serra, JosÃ© Carvalho

  • Method Details

    • setInitialize

      void setInitialize​(boolean value)
      Changes the value of the variable initialize to control the state of the game.
      Parameters:
      value - (true/false)

    • setState

      void setState​(int newState)
      Changes the state of the state machine (1) Initial menu. (2) Load the game. (3) Exit. (4) Restart the game. (5) Cleans old game and goes to main menu.
      Parameters:
      newState - State to change in to.

    • getTerminal

      void getTerminal​(int newState)
      Returns the terminal in use.
      Parameters:
      newState -

    • getscreenH

      int getscreenH()
      Returns the height of the screen.
      Returns:
      value of the screen height

    • getscreenW

      int getscreenW()
      Returns the width of the screen.
      Returns:
      value of the screen width.

    • quit

      void quit​(int status) throws IOException
      Parameters:
      status - Controls the type of exit: if it's a controlled one or an error.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • run

      void run()
      Main function. Functions as a state machine for the entire game never stops to run handling all the stages that the games goes through.

    • newGame

      void newGame()
      Creates a new game re/initializing the variables to run the game.
